availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Marion County, Kentucky, merchant. Pennsylvania native. Married to Mary Elizabeth Hager Johnston in Washington County, Kentucky, on December 29, 1841. Father of Mary A. Johnston, Joseph H. Johnston, William Johnston, Charlie A. Johnston, Sarah E. Johnston, Laura B. Johnston, Wallace H. Johnston, and Clinton B. Johnston. Tin plate worker in Marion County in 1850. Hardware merchant in Marion County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, p. 330A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, District 2, p. 739.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States_ (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, Lebanon, p. 95A.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 16594.
"Hervey Johnston (1813-1890)," Find A Grave, Memorial #82811951, accessed May 18, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/83811951/hervey-johnston.
